info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:26AM CDT until June 01 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FLOYD...MOTLEY AND COTTLE COUNTIES... At 125 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Swearingen to near Dougherty, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Paducah, Matador, Dougherty, Cee Vee, Swearingen and Roaring Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
